Summary Reports allow users to group and summarize data based on specific criteria, such as the case status and the date. By creating a Summary Report, customer services can group the cases by the date and filter them based on the open status. This will provide them with a summarized view of the number of open cases for each day over the desired period of time.

Matrix Reports, on the other hand, are useful for analyzing data across both rows and columns, which may not be necessary for this specific requirement. Tabular Reports provide a simple list of records without any grouping or summarization. Analytic Snapshot is used to capture and report on historical data, which may not be relevant for analyzing the number of open cases each day.

Therefore, Summary Reports would be the most suitable option for achieving this analysis

Standard picklist fields in Salesforce can indeed be controlling or dependent. Controlling picklist fields determine the available values for dependent picklist fields based on the selected value in the controlling field. This functionality allows for dynamic and contextual selection of values in dependent picklist fields based on the value chosen in the controlling picklist field.

questions.answer_description: Standard picklist fields can be controlling fields but not dependent fields.
